header_summary: Proposal to Use "nExpiryHeight" Instead of Time-Based Expiration in ProgrammingThe sender suggests using "nExpiryHeight" as an alternative to time-based expiration in programming, highlighting the issues with relying on time-based expiration. They propose redefining an OP_SuccessX opcode and suggest names like "OP_Expire" or "OP_CheckExpiryTime" for the opcode. Additionally, they acknowledge their previous mistake and propose a separate field like "nExpiryHeight" for cases where a signature covering the field is sufficient. For more information, refer to the link provided at https://petertodd.org.

active_posts.title: Proposed BIP for OP_CAT
active_posts.summary:
- A draft BIP proposes enabling OP_CAT as a Tapscript opcode, allowing concatenation of values.
- OP_CAT aims to expand tapscript's functionality, enabling tree signatures, logical spend conditions, and more.
- Tapscript enforces a max stack element size of 520 Bytes, addressing memory usage concerns.

active_posts.title: Removing channel reserve for mobile wallet users
active_posts.summary:
- The email proposes removing the channel reserve requirement for channels between wallet users and providers.
- Removing the reserve can improve capital efficiency and user experience but risks griefing by providers.
- The service provider pays on-chain fees and users can still recover funds using penalty transactions.

active_posts.title: Batch exchange withdrawal to lightning requires covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The sender discusses using covenants, specifically `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT`, to enable lightning withdrawals.
- The current method of enabling lightning withdrawals creates issues for users and wallet providers.
- The `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` covenant resolves the issue by allowing anyprevout signatures for the commitment transaction.
